abstracts.cdata!:
The Transport Parastatals Project is
            designed to improve the performance of key transport
            parastatals and assist the Federal Government in its initial
            efforts more generally to reform transport parastatals. The
            project will provide funds for three components. The first
            includes technical assistance and training for the Nigerian
            Ports Authority and the Nigerian Railway Corporation to: (i)
            improve internal financial controls, accounting and
            management information systems, (ii) define financial
            targets, (iii) carry out revenue/cost studies, (iv) assist
            in manpower planning and development, (v) assist in
            improving workshops and operations, and (vi) promote more
            effective use of computer facilities. The second component
            involves the acquisition of computer, workshop and training
            equipment and spare parts in support of the above-mentioned
            technical assistance. Finally, the last project element
            provides technical assistance and consulting services to the
            Federal Ministry of Transport and Aviation to carry out a
            range of policy studies including: (i) the future options
            for other transport parastatals, (ii) defining the
            respective roles of Nigeria Airways and private operators in
            domestic aviation, and (iii) assessing the feasibility of
            inter-modal transport.
